metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7812 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If web content on a page is dragged onto portions of the browser UI, such as the tab bar, links can be opened that otherwise would not be allowed to open. This can allow malicious web content to open a locally stored file through "file:" URLs. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 56.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu1').
